This is the repository for medgrocer.com.

_Have another more specific idea? You may want to check out our vibrant collection of [official and community-created starters](https://www.gatsbyjs.org/docs/gatsby-starters/)._

## 🚀 Quick start

Navigate into your new site’s directory and start it up.

1. Clone this repository.

   _For Windows users, open Ubuntu, type the command `cd projects` before doing the next steps_

   ```shell
   git clone git@github.com:MedGrocer/medgrocer.com.git
   ```

1. Change directory to `medgrocer.com` and install dependencies.

   ```shell
   cd medgrocer.com/
   yarn
   ```

1. Create a `.env` file on the root folder, and paste the details from this [workplace post](https://medgrocer.workplace.com/groups/370824710374963/permalink/645251776265587/).

1. Run the project

   ```shell
   cd medgrocer.com/
   yarn develop -p 8001
   ```

Your site is now running! Visit `http://localhost:8001` on Google Chrome to view the website.

_Note: You'll also see a second link: _`http://localhost:8000/___graphql`_. This is a tool you can use to experiment with querying your data. Learn more about using this tool in the [Gatsby tutorial](https://www.gatsbyjs.org/tutorial/part-five/#introducing-graphiql)._

## 🧐 What's inside?

A quick look at the top-level files and directories you'll see in a Gatsby project.

    .
    ├── node_modules
    ├── src
        └── components
            ├── Elements
            └── Feature
                └── utils
            └── Layout
        ├── pages
        ├── services
        └── templates
    ├── static
        ├── styles
        └── images
    ├── .gitignore
    ├── .prettierrc
    ├── gatsby-browser.js
    ├── gatsby-config.js
    ├── gatsby-node.js
    ├── gatsby-ssr.js
    ├── LICENSE
    ├── package-lock.json
    ├── package.json
    └── README.md

1. **`Elements`**: All components reusable regardless of layout. Includes buttons, form elements.
2. **`Layout`**: All components used in the general layout of pages.
3. **`Services`**: Apis, computations, etc.
4. **`Static`**: Images, styles, jsons, etc.
5. **`Templates`**: Template components used in createPages or email templates.

_Note: Create a folder for each independent feature_
